explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 79.5degC (c.c.) (ICSC (2002)), which is classified into Category 4.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2294) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2294) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 716mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 716mg/kg and 782mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on human epidemiological findings of "skin irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)). Although classified into Category 2-3 because the severity of irritation is unknown, the substance should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on human epidemiological findings (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)): "The substance, in the form of vapour or mist, has a potential for irritation of the eyes, mucous membrane and upper respiratory tract." Also based on the evidence of "reddening and pain" (ICSC (1994)). Although classified into Category 2A-2B because the severity of irritation is unknown, the substance should be placed in Category 2A from the viewpoint of safety, if further subclassification is needed.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (two or more indices), described in NTP DB (Access on Mar., 2006), the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on expert judgment, given the absence of existing classification.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, kidney), Category 2 (nervous system), Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (blood system, kidney) May cause damage to organs (nervous system) May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "the substance, in the form of vapour or mist, has a potential for irritation of the eyes, mucous membrane and upper respiratory tract" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity, salivation, prone position, lateral position, generalized vellication and decreased body temperature, cyanosis and brown urine" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996)), "albuminuria, cyanosis" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-2 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (blood system, kidneys) and Category 2 (nervous system).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "cyanosis, decreased hematocrit levels/hemoglobin levels/RBC, increased reticulocyte count," (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=5.5mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=4.1(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 1.4%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
